markdown.markdown:
![](images/alina-headshot.jpg){width="120px" .headshot} **Digital Workplace Strategist | Knowledge Management Leader** North Vancouver, BC | [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/alinapukhovskaya) | [www.alinapukhovskaya.com](https://alinapukhovskaya.com)
## **About** I am a digital workplace strategist and knowledge management consultant with over 15 years of international experience across North America, Europe, Middle East and Asia. My work focuses on helping organizations enhance collaboration, adopt AI tools, and align knowledge practices with strategic goals. I am currently pursuing my MBA at University Canada West and I combine academic research with hands-on experience leading digital transformation initiatives for ,u clients. I am passionate about making knowledge systems work smarter - so people can, too.
## **Education** **Master of Business Administration (MBA)** *University Canada West, Vancouver* - *Expected 2025* **Ph.D. in Economics** *University of Vitez, Bosnia and Herzegovina* - *2018* **Diplom-Kauffrau (Equivalent to MBA)** *University of Saarland, Germany* - *2010*
## **Professional Highlights** ### **Research Assistant** *University Canada West, Vancouver* - *2025 to Present* Contribute to academic projects on AI in education. Co-author publications and analyze qualitative data using NVivo. ### **Manager, Knowledge Management** *KPMG US (IT Department), Mexico City* - *2020 to 2024* Led digital transformation for a 2,500-employee IT division. Championed AI adoption, redesigned governance frameworks, and optimized collaboration platforms serving 9,000+ users. ### **Knowledge and Productivity Consultant** *Self-Employed, Vancouver* - *2020 to Present* Provide consulting and training on knowledge management, AI tools, and productivity strategies for global clients.
## **Key Skills and Strengths** - Digital Workplace Transformation - Knowledge Management - AI-Enabled Collaboration - Process Improvement - Project Leadership - Cross-Functional Team Management - Research and Data Analysis - Multilingual Communication (English, Russian, Spanish, German)
